item.title: üìò Manual
item.description: There are two significant types of acquisition: live üçÄ and dead ‚ò†Ô∏è. Choosing based on the system’s initial state in question is usually preferable.

item.title: üßº Media Sterilisation
item.description: Before copying evidence or making a disk image, one needs to sterilise the target media to ensure that data on that disk before this operation would not meddle with the evidence data.

item.title: üß∞ Acquisition Toolkit
item.description: If this system is running, capture the memory. Should be the first task. Memory stomping issues.

item.title: ü§ñ Android Evidence Collection
item.description: File System Logical Backup - doesn’t copy all, doesn’t copy slack, free space and deleted files.

item.title: ü§î RAM Collection
item.description: Here I will collect information about RAM acquisition for various systems.

item.title: Collecting Containers
item.description: Containers are, by their nature, highly volatile. This property of containers runs contrary to the fundamental forensics need to preserve evidence.

item.title: VM Acquisition
item.description: […]they all need to be backed by a disk image, which is a file that represents an entire raw physical disk.
